title: Lesson A1-3 Assessment: Ejective Consonants Deep Dive

questions.question: How many ejective consonants does Georgian have?
questions.explanation: Georgian has exactly six ejective consonants: კ [kʼ], პ [pʼ], ტ [tʼ], წ [tsʼ], ჭ [tʃʼ], and ყ [qʼ].

questions.question: What is the key mechanism for producing ejective consonants?

options.text: Closing your throat, building pressure, then releasing with a pop

questions.explanation: Ejective consonants require closing your throat (vocal cords), building pressure in your mouth, and then releasing with a distinctive 'pop' sound. This is completely different from aspirated (air) or voiced (vibration) consonants.

questions.question: Which ejective consonant is produced the furthest back in the throat?
questions.explanation: ყ [qʼ] is a back velar ejective, made way back in the throat, almost at the uvula. It's the most challenging ejective to produce and requires positioning your tongue very far back.

questions.question: Match the ejective consonants to their IPA symbols:
questions.explanation: All six ejectives with their IPA symbols: კ [kʼ], პ [pʼ], ტ [tʼ], წ [tsʼ], ჭ [tʃʼ], ყ [qʼ]. Notice all have the [ʼ] symbol indicating they're made by closing your throat.

questions.question: Which word contains two ejective consonants?
questions.explanation: წყალი [tsʼqʼali] contains two ejective consonants: წ [tsʼ] and ყ [qʼ]. This makes it one of the most challenging words to pronounce correctly! პაპა also has two (both პ), but წყალი has two DIFFERENT ejectives.

questions.question: What is the difference between თ [tʰ] and ტ [tʼ]?

options.text: თ is aspirated (air), ტ is ejective (pop)
თ is ejective, ტ is aspirated
თ is voiced, ტ is voiceless

questions.explanation: თ [tʰ] is aspirated - released with a puff of air. ტ [tʼ] is ejective - made by closing your throat and popping. These are completely different sounds in Georgian. Example pair: თხა [tʰxa] (goat) vs ტბა [tʼba] (lake).

questions.question: Which word correctly uses an ejective consonant?
questions.explanation: ტბა [tʼba] (lake) uses ejective ტ [tʼ]. All the other options use aspirated consonants: თ [tʰ], ქ [kʰ], ფ [pʰ].
